places_with_reviews.name: Kalarivathukkal Bhagavathi Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Valapattanam Post, W9F3+R5W, Valapattanam, Kannur, Kerala 670010, India

reviews.text: The staff was friendly and attentive, and the room was comfortable with great views. The food at the restaurant was delicious, and the overall atmosphere was welcoming. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Munnar!”

Near the Highway between Valapattanam and Puthiyatheru.
It is an ancient Hindu temple in Kannur, Kerala, dedicated to Bhagavati. The historical charm, with the Naga thara and the serene old pond, created a unique and spiritually enriching atmosphere. The intricate architecture and cultural significance make it a must-visit destination for those seeking a glimpse into the region's rich heritage.

Here Bhagawati god Badrakali is main god which is worshiped. We all consider this temple powerful with attributes of Bhagawati.  You can offer here prayers and in Prasadam meat is served here too.
You can also offer prayers and get & tie Black strings in your Hand.
It's located in 20 minutes drive from main Kannur city center.
The famous bagavathi shetram in malabar, the last theyyam is conducted here at every year, after the festival the whole ulasavm are finishes at malabar, the biggest thirumudi is here

Entering the temple , I was immediately struck by the vibrant colors and intricate carvings that adorned its walls. The scent of sandalwood incense lingered in the air, mingling with the sounds of soft chants and the ringing of bells. ✨

places_with_reviews.name: Shri Pallikunnu Mookambika Temple
places_with_reviews.address: Devi Rd, Pallikkunnu, Kannur, Kerala 670004, India

reviews.text:
1500 years old temple.
It is known as the second Saraswathi temple after kollur temple. It is believed that parasuram built this temple. Every day 8:00 am to 9:30 am, vidyarambha  can be offered.

Calm and serene. Plenty of parking space.

It is one of the oldest temples in Kerala and is a great place to take your kids and family. It is a very good place to find your spiritual self. It has ample space for parking 🅿️ your vehicles 🚗🚘🚐🚙🏎️🛵🏍️🚲, but the area is not covered and your vehicles will be out in the rain ☔🌧️🌨️🌧️🌦️🌩️ and sun 🌞☀️😎. It is visible from inside your car and is on the side of the road with two approach roads. Currently, the entrance is NOT accessibility ♿ enabled.

The function was carried out in a befitting manner and thousands of kids started their vidhyarambham from this temple on this auspicious day. Get a good dharsan of ma Mookambika and thank God for getting a chance to visit the temple on a very special day.
Very beautiful temple and very peaceful place .There is  2 ponds.very neat and maintained well

places_with_reviews.name: Kaattile Palli Darga(Moonnu Pettumma Makham)

reviews.text: This is a popular Muslim Shrine (Maqam) in Kannur Dt., where people visit regardless of their religion or caste. During the 7 days of Nercha (festival), the public can witness large crowds of devotees heading to the shrine to offer prayers and things. Makeshift shops which sell foods, drinks, toys, clay pots, agriculture equipment etc.. are a very popular attraction during the Nercha.
Its a popular Muslim dargah in kannur. The masjid maqam welcomes every religion with open arms
Good traditional mosque

Its a place where all are welcome . Usually the festival longs for 7 days . Irrespective of religion all go for worship though it is a mosque . Actually this place is the grave of an umma(mother) and her three children
Great Dargha Shareef with interesting history,  many females come to ziyarat here.

places_with_reviews.name: Chirakkal Chamundi Kottam

reviews.text: It is an ancient temple in kannur which was not so famous, but recently a grand festival called "Perumkaliyattam" was conducted after 45 years, so now everyone knows this place very well. The temple is situated near the chirakkal chira. The nearest known place is chirakkal Rajas higher secondary school, which is 1 km away from this temple. Usually, a perumkaliyattam is held every 12 years. But, since it needs copious amounts of organisational skill and resources, the festival is not held regularly. And after 45 years it has been done. A grand Annadhanm was also given every day on ulsavam days. Lakhs of people came here to watch the grand spectacle of the series of theyyams in action. So that there was a huge rush and everyone couldn't watch the theyyam performance smoothly. Here Theyyams performed nonstop like one by one without long waiting. More than 35 theyyam was performed here likely Thee chamundi, Yakshi theyyam, Gulikan, Karinkuttichathan, Uchita bhagavathi, Vairajathan, Ghantakarnan and Vayanattu kulavan are some of them. Apart from the continuous flow of theyyams, some other cultural programmes were also conducted. Not only from kannur but also from various parts of India people came and captured the programmes. Actually from the parking point we have to walk almost 1km to reach the temple, no private vehicles are allowed after this point.
Blessed to be here for the Perungaliyattam, 2023, happening here after a period of 45 years.
Grand festival after 45 years, devotees thronging in large numbers.
Divine. One of the best Theyyam festival happened here in April beginning after almost 40years
Crowded like anything. Hard to find a spot to get a good view.

places_with_reviews.name: MEENKUNNU BEACH

reviews.text:
Venturing to Meenkunnu Beach at the crack of dawn was pure magic! From the cliff's edge, we watched the sky transform into a canvas of vibrant orange hues, casting a spell of awe over us. Making our way down to the shore, the sight of our car parked up on the cliff added a quirky touch to the scene. With the soothing sound of waves in the background, we felt like we had the whole beach to ourselves.

It was a morning filled with joy and serenity, a memory we'll cherish forever ✨

Meenkunnu Beach, nestled along the Malabar Coast in Kerala, is a captivating stretch of golden sands and azure waters. The pristine shoreline and the gentle waves make it an idyllic escape for those seeking tranquility. The beach offers a serene ambiance, perfect for leisurely strolls and relaxation.

The coconut groves lining the coast add a tropical charm, providing shade and a picturesque backdrop. Meenkunnu Beach is relatively unspoiled, making it an ideal destination for those who appreciate natural beauty. The locals’ warm hospitality and the vibrant fishing community nearby contribute to the authentic coastal experience.

Visitors can witness stunning sunsets that paint the sky in hues of orange and pink, creating a magical atmosphere. The beach isn’t overly crowded, allowing for a peaceful connection with nature. However, amenities like beachside shacks offer delicious local seafood, enhancing the overall experience.

In summary, Meenkunnu Beach stands out as a hidden gem on Kerala’s coastline, offering a serene retreat with its untouched beauty, friendly atmosphere, and breathtaking sunsets.
Such a beautiful place, if you go during sunset time you will get an amazing experience from here
We had a Good time at Meenkunnu Beach, we went around 7 in the evening, there was almost no person on the bench, it was extremely thrilling and the walkable places were haunting

Meenkunnu cliff beach is very awesome for shootings and watching sunset or to have a good time with your loved ones. Also there is a view point from the top there you can see the sea from top which as stunning 🤩

places_with_reviews.name: Kadalayi Sri Krishna Temple, Chirakkal

reviews.text: Very good temple and divine place to offer and see god . a must place to visit if at kannur

It is one of the oldest temples in Kerala. The temple area is large and grand with paintings and murals. The temple has ample space for parking 🅿️ your vehicles 🚙🚘🚲🚗🚐, but it is not covered and your vehicles will be out in the rain ☔🌧️⛈️🌨️🌧️🌦️🌬️ and sun ☀️🌞😎🌟. Currently, the entrance is NOT wheelchair ♿ accessible right now. There are toilets 🚺🚹, but these are not well maintained. It is good place to go with your family and friends.

places_with_reviews.name: Chal Beach Park

reviews.text: One of the most underrated driving beach ( public cannot enter with vehicals ) we can enioy this beach by riding cycles or walking or running. The beach is around 3km and perfect for sunrise and sunset. At end of the beach (the right most end) we can see starting point of valapatanm river. Very nice beach ,must visit beach in kannur
One of the best beaches in Kannur. A nice palce to spend an evening with family. Not much crowded and reachable easily frm kannur. A small park also there for kids.

Nice beach to hangout with friends family and alone. Neat and clean beach give you a fresh mind and can spend a lot of time by just roaming around. There is a small park with limited rides for kids. Have a parking lot and small snacks shope near the beach. Mostly the beach is not crowded when compare with other beaches in kannur. We had a good time over .On coming dec 20 to jan 1st there is a beach carnival . It will be a nice experience too for the visitors
